intro: Ranunculus oxyspermus var. phrygius, commonly known as the Phrygian buttercup, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its delicate, palmately divided leaves and showy yellow flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms from late spring to early summer. Its flowers have five petals and are often accompanied by numerous stamens, making it a visually striking addition to gardens.
